text: Johannes Pettersen Løkke (28 January 1895 - 14 March 1988) was a Norwegian politician for the Labour Party. He was born in Kristiania. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from the Market towns of Telemark and Aust-Agder counties in 1950, but was not re-elected in 1954. Instead he served the next term in the position of deputy representative. Løkke was a member of Notodden city council from 1937 to 1969, serving as mayor in the periods 1945-1947, 1947-1951 and 1951-1954\. ==References== * Category:1895 births Category:1988 deaths Category:Labour Party (Norway) politicians Category:Members of the Storting Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians
title: Johannes Pettersen Løkke
